technologiesSection.title: Technologies and Tools
technologiesSection.description: These are some of the technologies and tools I work with and use in my projects.
technologiesSection.secondDescription: I'm always learning and improving my skills!

aboutSection.title: About Me

firstParagraph.text:
Let me introduce myself, Gabriel, I'm 22 years old and I'm a Computer Engineer with over 2 years of experience (working independently) dedicated to web development. I combine the knowledge I've acquired with a focus on clean code and best practices (SOLID, design patterns). My stack typically includes React 19, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS 4.



I consider myself a proactive person committed to continuous improvement. I firmly believe that true professional transformation requires certain sacrifices and teamwork to achieve high-impact goals. I enjoy collaborating in agile enviroments and adding value through creativity and innovation and innovation, using the latest technologies the market offers and not just what's trendy.



I am currently a graduate of Computer Engineering and I am certifying my knowledge.

aboutSection.note: AI-only work can be instantly recognized by noticing the absence of more advanced language/technology features, as well as a poorly scalable architecture.

documentationSection.title: Documentation
documentationSection.question: What is DeepWiki AI?
documentationSection.showDescription: You can view the project documentation on DeepWiki AI, an AI tool that automatically generates technical documentation. This tool uses a language model called Devin AI to analyze the code and generate clear and concise documentation.

gitHubStatus.privateInfo: You can request a preview by contacting me

sica-system.title: Criminal Information System SICA
sica-system.shortDescription: Full-stack web application for real-time registration, management, and analysis of criminal data.

details.overview: It was my thesis project and one of the largest I've completed. I developed a full-stack web application with another developer for real-time registration, management, and analysis of criminal data. Implemented with React + TypeScript in the Frontend and Django REST Framework + PostgreSQL in the Backend.
responsibilities: Migration from Tailwind CSS v3 → v4 to leverage new utilities and improve performance
Migration from JavaScript → TypeScript, adding typing to APIs and improving maintainability
Upgrade from React 18.3 → React 19
Creation of hooks and utilities for query-params management
Integration of React DevTools and configuration of ESLint/Prettier
Implementation of heat maps with Google Maps API for crime visualization
JWT Authentication with Django (login, refresh token) and consumption of REST APIs with pagination and serialization
Performance optimization: lazy-loading with React.lazy/Suspense and audits with Lighthouse
Management of query parameters through my own library @react-magic-search-params
Coordination with Back-End team via Git/GitHub, definition of +70 requirements and project leadership

videoDemostration.description: Experimental video, it has nothing to do with the project, but it's a test video to show how a video would look in the project detail view.

generalImage.label: SICA System Architecture
generalImage.description: A general view of the system modules, where you can see the system Architecture and how they communicate with each other.

bazaar-management.title: Bazaar Management System
bazaar-management.shortDescription: Complete web application for managing employees, sales and products for a bazaar

details.overview:
This is a system developed as an Integration Project back in 2023 during my Computer Engineering degree. I learned to implement forms, paginate data, and authenticate users with JWT. I also optimized the system's performance using lazy-loading and performance audits with Lighthouse. 

I revisited this project in 2024 to refactor the entire Frontend, which laid the foundation for developing the SICA Criminal Information System later that same year.
responsibilities: Implementation of forms and validations
Integration of REST APIs with pagination and serialization
JWT Authentication with Django (login, refresh token)
Performance optimization: lazy-loading with React.lazy/Suspense
Performance audits with Lighthouse
Managing the project on GitHub
Definition of requirements and project leadership
Complete refactoring of the system's Frontend with improvements in UI/UX, performance, and clean code.

hotel-management.title: Hotel Management System
hotel-management.shortDescription: Web application for managing reservations, customers, and rooms for hotel administration

details.overview:
It's a Hotel Management System that I developed during my Computer Engineering degree. I learned to implement forms, authenticate users, create user interfaces, and manage the project on GitHub. 

This project was a significant learning experience for me, as it was the first project I developed.
responsibilities: Implementation of forms and validations
Integration of REST APIs with serialization
Token-based authentication
Building user interfaces
Refactoring code
Managing the project on GitHub
Definition of requirements and project leadership
Consuming REST API endpoints
Building backend views
Creating database design

nasa-app.title: NASA Application
nasa-app.shortDescription: Mobile application that uses NASA's API to obtain daily astronomical data, including images and videos, presented to users in an attractive way.

details.overview:
This application allows users to view daily images and videos thanks to NASA's API. 

 Developing this project helped me improve my skills in mobile application development and API integration.
responsibilities: Structure the project with React Native
Integrate NASA's API to obtain daily astronomical data
Implement navigation between screens using React Navigation
Create an attractive and user-friendly interface using React Native components
Implement logic to display NASA images and videos in the application
Implement blur functionality for images and videos
Create my own library to handle Toast notifications @react-native-toast-lite

react-magic-search-params.title: React Magic Search Params
react-magic-search-params.shortDescription: React library for managing URL query parameters easily with TypeScript autocomplete support.

details.overview:
I developed this library to facilitate the management of query parameters in URLs for my React projects. 

The library allows for easy handling of query parameters and, thanks to TypeScript's autocomplete, it's easy to use. 

It's published on npm and has good documentation.
responsibilities: Research the npm package manager and how to publish a library
Create a Hook to manage URL query parameters
Create an interactive page to demonstrate the library's functionality
Create detailed documentation for the library
Deploy the interactive page on Netlify
Create a demonstration video for the library

portfolio.title: My Portfolio
portfolio.shortDescription: Personal portfolio developed with Next.js 15, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS 4.

details.overview:
I created my portfolio from scratch using Next.js 15, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS 4. 

The portfolio is fully responsive and has an attractive modern design. 

Additionally, I implemented a projects section where I showcase my most notable works and a contact section where users can send me a message.
responsibilities: Create the projects and contact sections
Implement navigation between sections
Create the skills and technologies section
Create the experience and education section
Create the skills and technologies section
Work on UI/UX details
Work on responsiveness for all screen sizes
Create highly reusable components
Add animations and visual effects without affecting performance and SEO
Ensure proper functionality for screen readers
Use the Next-Intl library for multi-language support, following the internationalization (i18n) process
Deploy the portfolio on Vercel
Add a custom domain
